We have arrived at the Sixth edition of the famous Q&A thread.
Many questions were asked and many were answered,
because of that make sure to use the search function!

Please consult the help page before posting here.

When asking a question please use this format:

[Guy who could use some help]
Q1 : Hello, how many cameras there is at the begining of a ship?

[Guy who's willing to help]
A1 : Hi ! three at least, if Gioele has his 2nd skill, there are 5 cameras.

Have fun asking and answering!

Q1: Is it possible to tell from the Daedalus if a pilot has ejected from their fighter?
On march 8, 2014
Kyubey

A1 You will see an empty patrol ship outside. Still it can be a patrol ship with a drone. But if you wait for cycle change a patrol ship with a drone will use 1-2 shots or return to bay, while if it's empty one - the ammo will be the same.

[6826491]

A3: It may be legit, depending upon the illness they claim to have. Slight Nausea for example, usually doesn't trigger the vomiting symptom unless the person consumes something while they have the illness. At least, that's been my experience with that illness. But as Nepsy said, check them with the medkit to be sure. It's also possible (at least with slight nausea) that it will go away on its own, before they person can be cured.
On march 8, 2014
Kyubey

A3 Had gastroenteritis - vomiting triggered with chance around 50%. Have not eaten anything while ill.

* on both sides for bolded
-- for striketrough
and you can combine them.

[6826491]

A5: Yes, leaving orbit with more than one fuel loaded will waste the excess fuel, but anyone watching the fuel gauge can see if more fuel than necessary has been extracted from the tank.

On the other hand, saying, "x amount of fuel has been loaded!" and then removing fuel from the combustion chamber right before the jump is a good way to make the humans miss their next destination. It's harder to catch that tactic as opposed to loading extra fuel, since the fuel is being carried, and the tank appears to have the right amount of fuel withdrawn. (Smart crews are going to check the engine room before each jump, though. So it's not always easy to pull this off.)
On march 8, 2014

Q6: what does convenient sink actually do? Its description is useless.
On march 9, 2014
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

It prevents you from getting dirty during an expedition (or reduces the chance of getting dirty).
On march 9, 2014
[6826491]

A6: It prevents you from becoming randomly dirty when returning from an expo. That's all it does, but it may be quite useful if Finola is a regular expo team member (as a Diplomat.) Note that it has zero use against illnesses that make you dirty, but it may save a few AP from not having to shower as often.

MoxrexQ7 How do you transform super jar of alien oil to fuels? And also is that jar cure all kind of things? (illness, psychological illness, wound, and maybe there's more)

A7 Dump it into the combustion chamber, it will turn into 5 fuel. It maxes your Hp and removes injuries(not diseases/disorders).
On march 9, 2014
Dorn

Q8: How do ya report players?
Some... asshole... has just cooked all 31 rations in first day.
On march 9, 2014
[6826491]

A8: On any relevant message in General chat, you'll see the report option. Make sure to explain what the player did, and that the correct player is selected in the report. Note that you can report ANY message, if the player in question hasn't said anything; their death notice tends to work as well.

Cooking always generates a log, so you'll know who did it. Also, kill them, because they are either griefing or Mush. There should be no mercy for such players.

It might not help in this case, but you can spend a LOT of AP and re-freeze those rations. It will turn them back into uncooked rations.
On march 9, 2014
Dorn

Thanks, I thought "report post" was like, reporting someone for offensive post or whatever.. that works.
On march 9, 2014
Kyubey

A8 (part about cooking-freezing)
There is not big harm in cooking all rations. All you need to do:
- switch food destruction off
- you have around 1.5-2 days (before second day change. for example - cooked on D2C3, will be ok before D4C1) to eat rations without any harm. Just let people working on link/research/projects/scans to eat as much as they can (2 rations/day) and all that ap will be used for team
- and let all others to eat 1 time too
- so you'll have to freeze only around 10-15 rations. 10-15ap is so little damage from mush - it's not "A LOT OF" at all (freezer needs to be fixed anyway, so I cannot say fixing it is wasting ap)
- 5 banana trees can save everyone from starving anyway
On march 9, 2014
npfan
Kyubey- you have around 1.5-2 days (before second day change. for example - cooked on D2C3, will be ok before D4C1) to eat rations without any harm. Just let people working on link/research/projects/scans to eat as much as they can (2 rations/day) and all that ap will be used for team

As soon as day changes, if you have food destruction off, the cooked rations have a 50% of making you sick. The chance becomes 90% after two day changes.

On march 9, 2014
Kyubey

As soon as day changes, if you have food destruction off, the cooked rations have a 50% of making you sick. The chance becomes 90% after two day changes.
On first day change they become "unstable" with 0%
On second day change they become "hazardous" with 50%
On third day change with 90%. Not sure about status name, something like "decompose"
We just had an alien fruit from an expo, that causes paranoia. So we left it in IB and watched all this statuses.
On march 9, 2014
Vince

10% you mean.
But yes, that is why Food Destruction is a horrible idea, even more so as the default: You could lose 5 AP cooked rations because of a 10% chance for a disease which, even if you got it, would only take 2 AP to cure. And it is probably Food Poisoning, Acid Reflux or something mild... not Sepsis.


Q10
Is it possible to get 2 spores at once from a Mush trap in a Cristalite zone?


(We had presumably killed/cured both Mush, then researched Mushovore, then I healed Frieda twice as a Mycologist. Yet when the trap sprung, the Mush Channel showed 2 spores on her.)
On march 9, 2014
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?
Vince10% you mean.
But yes, that is why Food Destruction is a horrible idea, even more so as the default: You could lose 5 AP cooked rations because of a 10% chance for a disease which, even if you got it, would only take 2 AP to cure. And it is probably Food Poisoning, Acid Reflux or something mild... not Sepsis.

No, Kyubey's right, Unstable is 0% (on the second day), then it's 50% on the third day and 90% on the fourth. The only possible disease is Food poisoning, which only lowers yours max hp and makes you dirty, so it's nothing serious (except for Finola or people who need to stay clean, but it's easily cured).

Q29: Does nano-ladybug reduce 2 cycles total or does it give 2 charges per day? (I don't answer the other questions because I don't know the answer )
On march 11, 2014
[6826491]

A28: It's generally best to wait until the ship is finished before posting conversations there. You never know what information someone from your ship could potentially use against you. (Say, if you posted a Mush skill question in the Q&A thread, someone from your ship might see the conversation and assume you're Mush.)

A29: It reduces the time to mature by two cycles, if the plant is in the Garden. It doesn't help too much with bananas, but it may make a big difference with alien fruit, since they mature in about a day. Two cycles sooner can mean the difference of an extra day with fruit and O2.

[7897795]

On march 11, 2014
[6826491]

A28a: There's no rule that states you can't post conversations there while the ship is ongoing, but we discourage it...if only because some people would post without realizing that they might be incriminating in some way. You're probably safe in this particular instance, however.

[8149672]

Q32: Is it possible to have the skill "Caffeine Junkie" as Giole if he is a mush? Is it possible to get it through the random skill?
On march 12, 2014
[7950824]

A32: Mush Gioele who has the caffiene junkie skill will still appear to have the skill, however he will gain no benefit from having it - no mush gains any effect from eating or drinking anything.

This can make pretending to be a human as Mush Gioele extra hard, because everyone expects you to gain 4 AP from each cup of coffee, and they often want you drinking as much coffee as possible - even if you don't do anything mushy that's a lot of AP to not be able to use.

Random skillbooks probably do not ever offer the Caffeine junkie skill - I've not seen it or heard about it at least - but I could be wrong. Stephen's Apprentice skill could allow Stephen to choose to become a caffiene junkie.

On march 13, 2014
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

A 42
Mush gain 3 when they kill a human (and the cat), 1 when they infect someone, 8 with the final spore when their victim becomes mush. All mush gain 7 when Chun dies, even if she dies of natural causes (injury, starvation, depression...), 16 when they reach Sol, 32 when they reach Eden, and 8 if they are killed by Neron when there are no humans left.

A 42B
You're not supposed to gain human glory when you're mush, so you don't get glory when you kill hunters, and characters don't gain glory from their personal objectives.

On march 13, 2014
[6826491]

A50: The drawback to OCD if you're Mush is that things you might normally use to explain yourself being dirty...won't actually make you dirty, since you have a permanent Apron with the OCD skill. An observant team is likely to catch you quickly if you get dirty, because you can't even claim to "forget" to use the Apron. I think the only excuses that apply are the SNC Kitchen (which requires another player to throw up on you) and expos, since you can still come back dirty from those. Of course, if the Convenient Sink project is completed, you can't even use that excuse, because that prevents you from becoming randomly dirty on expos.

So you'll probably have to leave the job of sporing to your partner, unless the human team is mostly braindead. This especially includes sporing the cat, since Finola doing that will instantly give her away as Mush. Anyone who has OCD as a Mush can safely be assumed to know how her Germaphobe trait works, and she probably can't get away with pretending to be a newbie, either.

Barlakopofaiis there a way to see how many people liked me in a ship or do I have to just guess where the likes come from?

Regarding likes, you'll see those when the names are revealed (either one week after the very last cycle of the ship, OR after everyone has confirmed their last words, whichever comes first.) You won't know who gave you likes, but you'll know how many each person on the ship had.

npfan

So what? Whether you have thousands of posts or thousands of threads, it's all the same.

I never really understood why the French implemented this Q/A numbering session in the first place. In all my years as an Alphabounce mod, we never had such system. If you had a question, you made a new thread. Did we get a bunch of threads that asked questions that have already been asked before? Of course we did. I just don't see how having a separate thread for 'simple' questions solves anything. It only changes the problem to one from many threads in a forum to many posts in a thread.

Having said that, I don't think there's anything wrong this system, but I think it's nonsense to argue this is somehow any better than having one question per thread.

In any case, I think a sticky thread for FAQ is a good idea. It won't fully solve the problem of repeated simple questions, but it will alleviate the problem.

On march 17, 2014
Kyubey

A67 Even if both mushes cannot agree (for example human team know you are online and have ap, while other mush discovered is afk) - just do what you see better for the team. There is no rule "human cannot kill human" or "mush cannot kill mush". In specific situation it can worth it.
On march 17, 2014
[6826491]

A67: If the other Mush has been caught in the act, and there is no doubt of it, then another Mush may join in the hunt to kill them. It doesn't have to be part of a Mush plan, and the other Mush doesn't have to agree to be killed in this case. It's understood that killing the discovered Mush will take some suspicion off of the Mush who is killing their partner, and this will help the Mush team.

That said, if the suspected Mush can do some additional damage/Transfer before being killed, that also advances the Mush team's goals. I know that's not always possible.

Darkfirephoenix

A102: An inactive Mush CAN die but only through injuries (steel plates to the face, fires etc.), but NEVER die because of starvation or Morale (wich are the main reasons inactives die on the most ships). Mush don't starve and they have full morale all the time so it's unlikely that they die on their own.
On march 21, 2014
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

A 99
You can't cure the cat if he's infected. You can kill him, but you will still lose glory when you reach Eden (less than if you go to Eden with an infected cat, though). I suppose the only way to prevent it would be to protect him, by carrying him or forbidding anyone to cuddle him while the mush are still alive.

A 100
A mush victory is much too subjective to define, but personally, I wouldn't say that reaching Eden with no mush and with the cure, even with an infected cat, can be a human defeat or a mush victory.

A 101
Raluca won't lose morale. French wiki also says that you will still lose glory if he's infected and gain glory if he's not.

A 102
Not all inactives die at the same time. Some can die of depression earlier because they had a panic attack or hadn't started the game when the connection so Sol was established. Others can have a better morale because they were in a dorm with a shrink or were in the room when Jin Su made a speech. It's the same with hunger. Tutorial players are hungry from the beginning and, if they don't eat, they die of starvation much earlier than those who ate or than those who didn't do the tutorial.

Those are just examples, there are several factors that can make inactives die earlier or later than others. But of course, if most inactives have died and others are still alive, it could also be because they're mush, since they don't lose morale and don't starve. An inactive mush can only die of injuries inflicted by the ship (fires, electrical spikes, metal plates...) or by other players.

Note that with the Vending Machine, it will display a random outfit each time you join a ship, and a new outfit will be displayed when you purchase the currently available one. If it's for the character you are now, then you can use it immediately. Otherwise, you can keep buying outfits over time; they are purely cosmetic.

Xandarth

I've seen no hunters after moving quite a few times as well.

I think Peanutz may be citing anecdotal evidence with his claim that hunters always appear when you move. Sometimes you get new hunters but likely you would have got new hunters on that cycle anyway.

I've seen hunters appear every single time the ship moves, and they appear both when the ship goes to a planet or when it leaves orbit. I don't usually generalize from my own experience, but I've been trying to check that theory for several months and it never failed once.

There are a few details that support that theory, like the fact that they don't behave that "normal" hunters (as I said, those asteroids hit in 5 cycles and not 6, and hunters fire immediately, not one cycle later like they usually do). There's also the fact that those waves generally have about half the number of hunters a normal wave would have, and the fact that sometimes, when the ship stops moving, you can have two different waves of hunters, with two different Neron announcements (the normal hunters you would have had anyway, and the one you get because the ship moved).

A129: Actually, it's usually wildly inaccurate, and that is strictly by design. This is one case where it's not a bug to be fixed. I've seen it display me as being offline, or connected "a long time ago", when I've been consistently active for several hours.

The reason for this is because it's far too easy to track everyone's activity, by inviting them all to one PM. Reliance on the times listed is something that this feature is specifically designed to prevent. If you're using the times listed as part of your Mush hunting evidence, you'll need much more than that.

[6826491]

A135: Generally, if a person isn't specifically reported for something, they won't get a sanction. There may be rare and extreme exceptions to that, of course. That said, it is often better to report it and let the judges clear the person, if they were indeed acting within the bounds of the rules.

If you have a strong suspicion of wrongdoing, but can't provide specific evidence, please note that when you are writing the report. Note whatever evidence you DO have, though. The stronger the case you present, the easier it will be for the judges to confirm those assertions. Doing this will also reduce the chance of you being sanctioned for abusing the report system. We don't often sanction people for filing abusive reports, but it has happened. If you have to report multiple players on a ship, do so, with this above caveat in mind.

A138a: You can also see how many likes players received, which many players consider to be better than glory, as far as knowing how "good" a player may be.

[7950824]

A145 follow up: Collecting scrap never seems to fail; it's either possible or not, but how much you can collect may vary a lot. Usually each hunter destroyed in that spot gives 1 scrap item, but rarely a hunter, or maybe even each dead hunter, can give 2. I've personally knew that all scrap had been collected in an area, that 3 hunters came and died, and I went for scrap and got 6 scrap items from that location, so all 3 hunters killed that cycle gave 'critical scraps'. But I've only seen that the once.

Additionally, how much scrap collected per attempt varies. For 2 AP you will for sure get 1 scrap, but you could get 2 or even 3. So if your pilot comes back with 6 scrap collected, that cost somewhere between 4 and 12 AP to get, plus the AP needed to take off and land.

Q146: Can you get panic attacks in the middle of a cycle, or only in the start of one?
On march 28, 2014
Terrorku

A146 You get them at the start of new cycle. If you lose 2 morale in the middle of cycle, maybe mush demoralize you.
On march 28, 2014
[6826491]

A146: Only at the start. If you just refreshed the page, then it might appear to be in the middle of a cycle; but if you refresh a second time, then you'll see the panic attack (always -3 morale) was at the beginning of the cycle.

Other (related) possibilities to consider: It's possible to lose morale during a cycle if someone dies, you eat something that causes morale loss, or if you get demoralized by a Mush. Demoralize is always -2 morale each time.

TheTylerLee

Q156: Whats the fastest way to suicide in a ship your all alone in?

A156: Suicide is against the rules even when you are alone. How to suicide is not a conversation that will happen on the forums.
On march 29, 2014
[6826491]

A156: Suicide (and surrendering) is strictly against the rules, so even if it isn't reported...having a history of committing suicide is still on your record, and that's not something you should want. Games must be played to their natural conclusion. Let me put it this way: If you commit suicide, regardless of the circumstances, you're screwing over any active players on your ship. They lose an active player, take an immediate morale hit, and they lose all the potential AP you could have spent had you remained alive. They don't get to commit suicide without consequences when things look bad, so why should you be the exception to the rule?

Now bear this in mind: Judges may not have access to your ship history when reports are filed, but the other mods and I do. If we see a history of suicide when we're looking at reports, we think, "This player is willing to screw over their team, just so they can start on another ship." It's treated as seriously as someone griefing their ships, because it IS a form of griefing. I wouldn't even recommend considering suicide as an option.

On march 31, 2014
[6826491]

A164: You can only earn one gold ticket per ship, whether you survive 10 days or 20+. Note that you separately earn one free ticket per month, so you may have some overlap there.

A165: Despite the odd and misleading description, the effect is this: The Convenient Sink prevents you from becoming randomly dirty while on expos. It has no effect on illnesses gained, so if you vomit upon return, you'll still get dirty from that. It's mildly helpful if Finola has Diplomat, and is a regular on the expo team. It can potentially save quite a bit AP in the long term, especially if the soap is no longer present.

[6826491]

Q174: is it possible for humans to be full after eating a ration for more than one cycle? i know mush get reset every cycle
On april 2, 2014
[7950824]

A174: If your satiation is higher than 3, you are full. Normally you'll lose 1 satiation a cycle. If you eat a couple of fruit then a ration, you can get your satiation up to 6, and have to wait three cycles before can eat again; the same thing will happen if you eat a ration as soon as possible after having been full. Certain Klix food has high satiation as well. Tapeworms change the timing of when you can eat again, but I've never had one to experiment with.

[6826491]

Andre: You have my post to quote. Feel free to point them to it.

There's also the point that if the Mush kill her right after Mush selection, and she never told anyone else where the hidden item(s) might be, the rest of the crew may have to waste AP searching the ship for them. Or worse, if Chun turns out to be an outright griefer, and the items she hid include the Mush Sample and Apron. If she were on your ship, you'd want her dead for that, and you'd be right to report her as well. There are no exceptions to the hiding of items before Mush selection.

After Mush selection, hiding items is at your own risk, depending on how much the rest of the crew trusts you.

fearpils The rule is, no hiding of any items before Mush selection. You took what you hid out of hiding, and I suppose that's fine in this case. Moving them elsewhere is fine. Hiding items, OR picking up and then holding them (since this is just "hiding" them in your inventory) is reportable. (Example of holding - picking up and then not dropping the Apron for several cycles.) Just don't hide anything before Mush selection in the future, and you won't have to worry about this rule.

Also note that next season, the Mush Sample won't even spawn until the moment of Mush selection; so at least that's one less item to worry about people using for a distinct advantage to either side.

[6826491]

Regarding tooltips and neutral play:

We've been requesting tooltip changes for a while now. One of the recent changes is that the Mush Sample won't spawn until the moment Mush selection happens, and that should be implemented for us with the next season. In the meantime, it might be a wise idea for the players to lay out some of the rules in the "newbie questions" thread, if your ship has one. Linking to the rules sticky (the one I linked in my last post) might also be a good idea. I usually make a post about the hiding of items before the ship fills, and if anyone asks, I usually tell them to ask before following what the tooltips tell them to do.

I should note I've come across players who question the value of neutral play, and I've occasionally revealed myself as a Mod in order to get the point across. Feel free to quote any of the Mod posts regarding neutral play, if you feel the need. I know I have posted many of them.

I've heard nothing about when the tooltips will see any overhaul, though when it comes to announcements about the game, we find out when everyone else does.

A211: No, not if there is conclusive evidence of the other player being Mush. Healing someone you know to be Mush is playing against your team, and that is very much reportable.

[7950824]

Suspicious behavior should always be reported. Not all suspicious behavior rates a ban, or even rates any form of correction.

The judges view the ship's logs, and it's pretty darn clear when a player is playing against their team. There are grey areas, for both mush play and human play.

A player who has already acted as only a mush should ever act, are they revealing anything if their words in any color text claim that they are a mush? Their actions already revealed them to be mush, the 'clear evidence' that blue4029 speaks of, whatever that may be - having done some action which only a mush should do, or perhaps only a mush can do, is there reason to avoid saying the words 'I am mush' for that player at that point?

Even in telling tales, even of ships not yet ended, interesting details may be included, or left out. That's why judges don't assign guilt or fault from one player's questions on the forum, the actual ship logs are checked for fault before judgement is made.

On april 11, 2014
[6826491]

A222: You may not hide or hold items prior to Mush selection. Not even Chun is an exception to this rule, despite what some players may think.

Items may be moved prior to Mush selection, but they are not meant to be held. Holding onto items for an extended period of time is considered the same as hiding them (albeit in your inventory) under this rule. Doing any of this prior to Mush selection is sanctionable if reported.

Not all of the rules are listed here, but this covers many of them.

._. Wait, holding something is illegal? Are you supposed to just drop it in a shelf and then just race the other people to get it at game start?
On april 11, 2014
[6826491]
Barlakopofai._. Wait, holding something is illegal? Are you supposed to just drop it in a shelf and then just race the other people to get it at game start?

It depends on the circumstances. If someone picks up the Hacker Kit, Apron, etc. from a turret, says nothing about it, then goes to a dorm and sleeps for 4-5 cycles, that's considered the same as taking it and hiding it somewhere. People are going to waste AP looking for it, and the rest of the crew is denied its use for an indefinite amount of time.

Contrast that with someone picking up the Apron, then announcing, "I don't have the AP to take this to the Lab now, but I'll bring it there in two cycles." As long as they keep to their word, and the item isn't in their inventory for more than a few cycles, it's not considered holding.

An easy alternative is to move that item to a dorm with a camera, and drop it on the shelf. Then the person who brought it there can announce where it is, and anyone who takes it from there should bring it to where it belongs.

On april 14, 2014
SummerMcLovin

A246 (let's say):
I don't think I'm overstepping any lines by saying that NERON Admin is the simplest Title, or at least the least work. Once you are assigned it by NERON, you should turn off Foodstuff Destruction, set the CPU Priority to Astro and if you want to mess around, allow Vocoder Announcements.
You won't need to do anything else until something comes up: changing the Priority if you have a big project like the Plasma Shield or Serum; changing the Pilot lock if you need someone else to use a ship/start an expedition; turning on the Plasma Shield; or turning off the Magnetic Net (if you happen to have a Mush or griever stealing a ship).

If you happen to be Mush, you can have a bit more fun with it by turning off death reports (although if you aren't around to /neron something to replace them, you'll likely be suspected), the Net to have the Commander 'accidentally' leave people behind and whatever else you can come up with.

If you buy things like an emotion or a ship upgrade from the vending machine, can you use either one repeatedly going forward, or on multiple characters? Are they one-ship only or one-character only?

Wraith_616Q 247: Is it possible with the trapper skill to double/triple a single shelf so that when someone touches it they get more than 1 spore infection?

Please note it works very differently. The in-game description is inaccurate and very misleading.

You do not really spore the shelf, and you get the spore only if you perform a room action in that room. Clicking on the shelf, interaction with your inventory does not count as the room action, and so you won't get spored. If Chun or the mush, they will just destroy the spore since they can't be infected.

This is what I was told. I haven't personally tested or verified it.

hottest
Jechtdoes attacking someone in that room counts as a room action or not?

I don't think so.

You get spored when you interact with the room by clicking on any action button of the room, like accessing terminal, picking up the item in that room etc. That's also why walking through the room or clicking on the shelf won't get you spored.

Attacking is a player-to-player interaction so I guess not.
On april 15, 2014
hottest
AlyarinQ254: How much of an efficiency does Raluca have on PILGRED?

It is the skill, not the character, that counts.
If you have a stupid Raluca who has Genius skill only (how ironic!), her efficiency will be 1%.

You will get 5-7% per repair if you have either physicist or technician skill.
You will get 9-13% per repair if you have both.
It does not matter what character you are.

On april 18, 2014
Sasquatch

Hey guys what can you tell me about hybridization? What are its pros and cons?
On april 19, 2014
Tpyo
SasquatchHey guys what can you tell me about hybridization? What are its pros and cons?

Its basically the same as planting a new fruit but you don't have to let the plant die (which you might have to if you don't have a living botanist). The plant has to be watered, disease free, and you need to be clean.

Pros:
You get the fruit and O2 from plants - if you let a plant die you would be out 2 fruit and 1 O2
You can hybrid ANYTIME, you can't plant over another living plant
Slightly shorter growth times (someone can chime in with how long with and without green thumb since I only remember seeing 2 cycles difference)
Cons:
Need a botonist
Can end up costing more ap or botonist actions because you need to water/treat or shower.
On april 19, 2014
[6826491]

To add/amend the above: Anyone can hybridize, but the 3 AP cost to do this can be expensive, which is why botanist points are preferred. To avoid wasting your botanist points to water/treat the target plant beforehand, let someone else use their AP, especially for watering. Treating with botanist points depends on how many points you have, and if you have someone with the AP to spare for you.

The Green Thumb skill and Hydroponic Incubator project each reduce the total number of required cycles for maturity by two; the latter only works if the plants are in the Garden (even in your inventory!). This reduction doesn't help too much with bananas, since they take so long, but most alien fruits mature in about a day to a day and a half...often less. The benefits in that situation are quite noticeable with alien fruits, especially if you're planting Jumpkins. I've seen alien fruit mature in just 2-4 cycles, for example.

A251: Yes, they can use the medkit anywhere, or perform DIY surgery in the Medlab.
